divs: sighting detailsmy husband and i went outside after 9pm tuesday, july 3rd, to read and relax. it has been so hot during the day that we missed being outside early in the evening, so this night we decided to take our travel chairs outside on the front patio and turn on the porch light to read. then, i heard him say something above us looks odd. we live a few miles from an airport that mostly has biplanes and an occasional jet; usually smaller engine type aircraft. i looked up and right overhead was a flying vehicle that at first looked like it could have been a plane. it was heading in a very slow northwest direction from the south. as we watched it, we heard no engine hum; in fact, it gave no sound at all. what struck us odd was that it had four perfectly spaced lights that were larger than those of higher flying planes. typically well see planes with flashing strobe lights and the green\red starboard and port lights flashing as well. the lights were perfectly spaced apart and solid, only the ones on the east and west sides (it was flying northward) flashed but not quickly like the typical planes lights. we watched it slowly fly above us northward until it disappeared from sight. it might have been a plane, but other planes in the area that night all gave a hum and the lights were smaller, brighter and had the green & red colors. this "square object" was, from our standpoint, about the size of a quarter or 3\4" diameter. as a comparison, the lights on the other planes at a similar, or higher, altitudes were the size of a small pointed felt-tipped marker, while the strange craft had lights the size of pencil eraser heads; definetely larger and not as bright or strobe-like. it might have been a plane, but it was odd enough that we thought we should report it just the same.
